meanings.definition: A rectangular column that projects slightly from a wall.
meanings.sent1: The ancient building had a pilaster on each side of the entrance.
meanings.sent2: The interior designer added a pilaster to give the room a classic look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat tried to climb the pilaster but quickly gave up.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as a pilaster, unwavering and solid.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight cast a shadow behind the pilaster, creating a dramatic effect.

meanings.definition: A shallow rectangular architectural element resembling a column.
meanings.sent1: The pilaster on the facade added a touch of elegance to the building.
meanings.sent2: The museum's hallway was adorned with intricate pilasters along the walls.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended the pilaster was a secret doorway to a magical world.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as straight and structured as a pilaster in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The pilaster stood tall and proud, a silent guardian of the architecture.
